full_summary:
### SAS – Generator and Electrical Room Improvements

**Public Notice**
The National Research Council of Canada invites qualified bidders to submit tenders for the Generator and Electrical Room Improvements project at 110 Gymnasium Place, Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

**Description**
The project includes the installation of a new electrical generator, transfer switch, panels, and transformer, as well as the demolition of existing redundant electrical equipment, conductors, and fuel tanks. This project involves electrical, mechanical, and architectural work.

**Tender and Site Visit Requirements**
- **Tender Closing Date**: November 17th, 2022 at 14:00.
- **Mandatory Site Visit**: All bidders must attend a site visit at 110 Gymnasium Place on either November 1st or November 2nd, 2022. Site visits will be held at 10:00.
- **Sign-in Form**: A mandatory sign-in form will be completed during the site visit.

**Eligibility Requirements**
- **Security Requirement**: All personnel involved with the project must be security screened to RELIABILITY status level as defined in the security policy of Canada.
- **WORKSAFE Saskatchewan Certificate**: Bidders must provide a valid WORKSAFE Saskatchewan certificate with their tender or prior to contract award.

**Bidding Process and Contract Administration**
- **Tender Documents**: Tender documents can be obtained from Buyandsell.gc.ca TMA services provider.
- **Addenda**: Addenda will be available on Buyandsell.gc.ca TMA service provider.
- **Contact Information**: For inquiries, e-mail Collin Long at Collin.Long@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca or phone (343) 549-1549.

**Selection and Award**
- **Bidding Period**: The bidding period is now closed.
- **Notice of Contract Award**: The notice of contract award will be sent to all contractors who submitted a tender.

**Office of the Procurement Ombudsman**
The Office of the Procurement Ombudsman (OPO) provides an independent avenue for suppliers to raise complaints regarding the award of contracts under $25,000 for goods and under $100,000 for services. For more information, visit www.opo-boa.gc.ca.
